column4: Anyone know a non-destructive partition resizer for ext2/ext3?
the gnome-partition editor
gparted
Is it NON-DESTRUCTIVE?
no promises, but it should be
I mean does it tamper with my data when I resize it?
nope
no promises though :D
What about internal file fragmentation, then?
I dpm, all I know is it didn't kill my partitions
I don't know, all I know is it didn't kill my partitions
Does it handle that, when I try to expand a partition on the begining of the cylinder?
OK.  Thank you very much.
I don't know, sorry
I wanted to pick between GParted, QTParted, and extresize
ah.  I've only ever used gparted, and it works well enough
Or anything that weren't in my radar ;)
I've used many. But like only GParted (interface) and QTParted (Stability)
I know. I just refrain from using the commandline interface
What I mean by stability is that GParted doesn't allow too much tweaking.  FS block size for example.
it's gnome :)
ok.  thanks.
